intro: Nepeta maussarifii, commonly known as the Maussarif's catnip, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with a serrated margin. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and are usually blue to purple in color. Nepeta maussarifii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
